channel.title: Decrypting Sniffed packet information help please!
channel.description:
Ok, i play counter-strike and i am trying to packet sniff the rcon password. I am using Etherdetect to capture all the data and i have tried it on my LAN, which is sent unencrypted and it worked great... Now im trying it on a server i know the RCON pw to, and im having my friend do it while i am still in the server. I have the captured data exactly as i had it before.. it came out into gibberish (encrypted data i assume) so i need to know how to decrypt or need a program to decrypt my captured data. Please help............!
Some of my gibberish:
:..õ...#ß("? rAYR)ã.‹6².p;ªø!‚Z.ØjS.0;š°9Š .À:[>8;úõ
¼...ìG..fyO»Us.¹âB=.j ].aÿ«. ¸îx9¼¼"..¬..\
Please help!!!!!!!!!

so what do i do to find out the encryption password to my server? or cant i do that? because other people have done it and they said they packet sniff so im trying to figure out how they did it

[/quote][/quote]My guess is that it’s RC4 using a syncrhonized pass…

item.title: Decrypting Sniffed packet information help please!
item.dc:creator: @Brazen_Bull Brazen Bull
item.description:
@Brazen_Bull wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:11, topic:111030”]What is it with all these script kiddies lately. If they’re not trying to DOS attack people’s webservers then they’re trying to steal passwords.[/quote]It’s not so bad. I mean when you’re young (I’m assuming he is from his name), these are the only sort of computer skills that would really interest you. Sure, it’s stupid and annoying, but so is everything to do with young kids. If Poopy here develops a life long interest in computers, then who cares if he an online nuissance at the age of 13?

[quote=“poopy4231, post:4, topic:111030”]how is it impossible if i just got the packets the only problem is that there encrypted?[/quote]It’s impossible because there’s no sensible reason why the packet would contain the password. It’s something else. Plus, whatever the packet was, it most likely wasn’t encrypted. Servers and clients don’t always communicate in plain text readable to humans.

I’m not going to help you anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Decrypting Sniffed packet information help please!
item.dc:creator: @Brazen_Bull Brazen Bull
item.description:
@Brazen_Bull wrote:

I don’t know anything about CS servers, but from what I understand from your post, what you’re trying to do is impossible.

Here’s what the sniffer can do:

  • A packet sniffer will always detect information going to and from the computer it’s running on.
  • A packet sniffer can usually pick up all the traffic on the LAN, but might have to do some evil hacky stuff first (look up ARP poisoning).
  • Some can pick up everything sent wirelessly, even if you’re not in the lan.

What you’re trying to do requires you to intercept packets going between your friend’s computer and the server. If your friend isn’t on the same LAN, a simple packet sniffer won’t do it. Being on the same server as him won’t make any difference, as the information is only going between him and the server.

Hope that helps.

Read full topic
item.source: Decrypting Sniffed packet information help please!
